abstract: The biggest thing in mergers and acquisitions this month is Oracle’s $7.4 billion deal for Sun Microsystems. So, I was happy to see that Sun filed its agreement to be acquired by Oracle on Monday evening rather than waiting the full four business days allowed under the Securities and Exchange Commission’s Form 8-K rules. I would like to think they did so out of solicitude for Sun shareholders, but more likely it was done in order to notify any other third-party bidders of the deal protection devices that were included.
lead_paragraph: The biggest thing in mergers and acquisitions this month is Oracle’s $7.4 billion deal for Sun Microsystems. So, I was happy to see that Sun filed its agreement to be acquired by Oracle on Monday evening rather than waiting the full four business days allowed under the Securities and Exchange Commission’s Form 8-K rules. I would like to think they did so out of solicitude for Sun shareholders, but more likely it was done in order to notify any other third-party bidders of the deal protection devices that were included.

headline.main: Examining the Terms of the Sun-Oracle Deal
